plugin.name: airtable
plugin.description: Access Airtable bases, tables, and records for data management and workflow automation
plugin.context: Airtable is a cloud-based database platform that combines spreadsheet simplicity with database power. Use this plugin to read/write records, manage tables, filter and query views, handle attachments, and integrate structured data into your workflows and dashboards.

list_bases.description: List all accessible Airtable bases for the authenticated user
list_bases.usage_context: Use this action first to discover which bases you have access to. Returns base IDs, names, and permission levels. Essential for getting the base_id needed for other actions.

output_guidance.success_description: Returns array of bases with IDs, names, and permission details

list_records.description: List and query records from a table with filtering, sorting, and pagination
list_records.usage_context: Use this action to retrieve multiple records from an Airtable table. Supports filtering by formula, sorting by fields, selecting specific fields, and pagination. Perfect for querying data sets, generating reports, or syncing data.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

table_name.description: The name or ID of the table to query

view.description: Optional: Name of a specific view to use for filtering and sorting

fields.description: Optional: Array of field names to return (returns all fields if omitted)

filter_by_formula.description: Optional: Airtable formula to filter records (e.g., '{Status} = "Active"')

sort.description: Optional: Array of sort objects to order results

max_records.description: Maximum number of records to return (default: 100)

output_guidance.success_description: Returns an array of records with their IDs, fields, and metadata

get_record.description: Get a single record by ID with all field details
get_record.usage_context: Use this action to retrieve detailed information about a specific record when you know its record ID. Returns all fields and metadata for that record.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

table_name.description: The name or ID of the table

record_id.description: The ID of the record to retrieve (starts with 'rec')

output_guidance.success_description: Returns the record with ID, fields, and metadata

create_records.description: Create one or multiple new records in a table
create_records.usage_context: Use this action to add new records to an Airtable table. Can create up to 10 records in a single request. Provide field names and values according to the table schema.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

table_name.description: The name or ID of the table

records.description: Array of records to create (max 10 records per request)

fields.description: Object containing field names as keys and values

typecast.description: If true, Airtable will attempt to convert string values to the appropriate field type

bulk_create.message: You are about to create {count} records in {table_name}. Continue?

output_guidance.success_description: Returns array of created records with their new IDs and field values

update_records.description: Update existing records with new field values
update_records.usage_context: Use this action to modify existing records in an Airtable table. Can update up to 10 records in a single request. Supports both full replacement and partial updates of fields.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

table_name.description: The name or ID of the table

records.description: Array of records to update (max 10 records per request)

id.description: The ID of the record to update

fields.description: Object containing field names and new values

typecast.description: If true, Airtable will attempt to convert string values to the appropriate field type

destructive.description: If true, clears fields not included in the request (full replacement). If false, only updates specified fields (partial update)

bulk_update.message: You are about to update {count} records in {table_name}. Continue?

destructive_update.message: Destructive mode will clear all fields not specified in the update. Continue?

output_guidance.success_description: Returns array of updated records with their IDs and new field values

list_tables.description: List all tables in a specific base with metadata
list_tables.usage_context: Use this action to discover available tables in an Airtable base. Returns table names, IDs, and basic metadata. Helpful for dynamically working with bases where table structure may vary.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

output_guidance.success_description: Returns array of tables with their IDs, names, and metadata

upload_attachment.description: Upload a file attachment to a record's attachment field
upload_attachment.usage_context: Use this action to add file attachments to a record. The file must be provided as a Base64-encoded string or a publicly accessible URL. Airtable will process and store the attachment.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

table_name.description: The name or ID of the table

record_id.description: The ID of the record to attach the file to

field_name.description: The name of the attachment field

url.description: Publicly accessible URL of the file to attach (Airtable will download and store it)

filename.description: The filename to use for the attachment

output_guidance.success_description: Returns the updated record with the new attachment added to the specified field

get_attachment_urls.description: Get download URLs for attachments from a record (URLs expire after 2 hours)
get_attachment_urls.usage_context: Use this action to retrieve temporary download URLs for file attachments stored in an Airtable record. Note: URLs expire after approximately 2 hours for security reasons and must be downloaded before expiration.

base_id.description: The ID of the Airtable base (starts with 'app')

table_name.description: The name or ID of the table

record_id.description: The ID of the record containing attachments

field_name.description: The name of the attachment field

output_guidance.success_description: Returns array of attachment objects with temporary download URLs (expire in ~2 hours)
